repo.name: onnx
repo.description: Open standard for machine learning interoperability

cves.summary: Open Neural Network Exchange (ONNX) Path Traversal Vulnerability
onnx allows Arbitrary File Overwrite in download_model_with_test_data
Onnx Directory Traversal vulnerability
Directory Traversal in onnx

A vulnerability in the `download_model` function of the onnx/onnx framework, before and including version 1.16.1, allows for arbitrary file overwrite due to inadequate prevention of path traversal att
Onnx Out-of-bounds Read vulnerability

Versions of the package onnx before and including 1.15.0 are vulnerable to Directory Traversal as the external_data field of the tensor proto can have a path to the file which is outside the model cur
Versions of the package onnx before and including 1.15.0 are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read as the ONNX_ASSERT and ONNX_ASSERTM functions have an off by one string copy.

Versions of the package onnx before 1.13.0 are vulnerable to Directory Traversal as the external_data field of the tensor proto can have a path to the file which is outside the model current directory

readme.summary: Well-organized reference documentation with clear project overview, but lacks practical quick-start examples showing how to actually use ONNX in code.
readme.top_issue: No inline code examples showing basic usage - users must click through to external documentation to understand how to load, create, or manipulate ONNX models

common_complaints: Build failures and CMake configuration issues across Python versions and platforms
Shape inference limitations and missing data propagation features
Platform support gaps (Raspberry Pi, Python 3.14t, pyodide wheels)
praise_themes: Clear feature request process and operator proposal discussions
sentiment.summary: ONNX shows active maintenance with engaged community, but faces persistent infrastructure challenges around build systems and platform coverage that require attention.

injection_risks.description: The use of os.listdir() could potentially lead to a directory traversal attack if the input is not properly sanitized.
